page.title: 20Knott Hill Farm.
page.content: The farm is a typical{dairy}farm on the slopes below Hartshead Pike and was farmed,as{tenants,}by MR. and MRS. Millin for 20 years from 1964 to 1984. During this time they have noticed an increased use of machinery for milking and general{farming}which has improved efficiency enabling the farm to support more cows.In 1964 the farm had 4{cows;}in 1984 it had 30 cows each giving an average of 4 or 5 gallons of milk per day,that is a total daily yield of approximately 1200 Pints.Most of the milk is bottled and distributed via the family milk round throughout Hurst;in 1964 a pint of milk cost 5p compared with 23p today. Originally Mr.and Mrs. Millin were the only workers on the 28 acre farm.When they left 6 people worked there and the farm then occupied 50 acres;sadly the old farmhouse has been vandalised.
